Pings now come in all directions and it's not long before Tucson is complet=
ely confused as to which direction to go in.  He knew the best thing to do =
was to stay put when all else fails.  He appears extremely nervous yet does=
 not fire a single shot, even though he appeared to be a bit itchy with the=
 trigger finger.  But then a familliar energy signature rings a bell.  He n=
arrows his eyes further.

" The energy signature.. I feel it, I know who an=
d what it is.  And here I thought Unicron was finished.  This means big tro=
uble for everyone.  If we don't stop him now we'll lose every planet in the=
 universe, including Cybertron!"

He did not know if any Autobot was still =
out there.  If there was a chance that one of his comrades could pick up hi=
s signal, he was going to throw it out there and hope for the best.  He hop=
ed that his luminated signal would still work,lighting the way for all Auto=
bots to follow.    This was one battle he knew he couldn't afford to get hi=
s new comrades mixed up into without proper assistance.

" By the name of P=
rimus, if there are other Autobots out there, please, answer this call."

H=
e opens a small window on his left gauntlett, and casts the luminated Autob=
ot insignia as a beacon, for all Autobots to see, if there were any out the=
re to see it.
